terms.definition: A centralized system that organizes, stores, and facilitates access to organizational information and documentation to improve decision-making and collaboration
Standard Operating Procedure - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and safely
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, essential for compliance and accountability
Good Manufacturing Practices - quality assurance guidelines that ensure pharmaceutical products are consistently produced according to quality standards
Manufacturing Execution System - software that connects and monitors manufacturing processes on the factory floor in real-time
Quality Management System - a framework of policies, processes, and procedures used to ensure products meet quality requirements and regulatory standards
Detailed documentation that records all manufacturing steps, materials used, and quality checks performed during the production of a specific batch of pharmaceutical products
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit the same document or project with changes visible instantly to all participants
A unified system where all organizational documents and information are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple systems
The use of software to automatically execute repetitive tasks and processes without manual intervention, improving efficiency and reducing errors
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of drugs, medical devices, and other consumer products
European Medicines Agency - the European Union's regulatory body responsible for the evaluation and supervision of medicinal products
The process of organizing and classifying documents into logical groups or categories to improve searchability and information retrieval
The process of connecting different software systems or platforms so they can share data and work together seamlessly
